actor_awards.notes: Won the Academy Award for Best Actor for 'The Champ' (1931), famously sharing the honor with Fredric March in a tie. He won the Volpi Cup for Best Actor at the Venice Film Festival for 'Viva Villa!'. Known for his gruff, tough-guy persona often paired with a heart of gold, particularly in his frequent collaborations with Marie Dressler and child actor Jackie Cooper.

filmography.title: The Champ
filmography.role_description: A washed-up, alcoholic former heavyweight champion trying to make a comeback for the sake of his adoring young son.
filmography.plot: A down-on-his-luck boxer struggles with gambling and drinking while trying to provide a better future for his loyal son, Dink.

filmography.title: Grand Hotel
filmography.role_description: A desperate industrialist who resorts to fraud and deceit to save his failing textile business.
filmography.plot: A group of very different individuals staying at a luxurious hotel in Berlin deal with each of their respective dramas over the course of one day.

filmography.title: The Big House
filmography.role_description: A menacing yet charismatic prison inmate who rules the cell block and leads a violent riot.
filmography.plot: A young man convicted of manslaughter is sent to a brutal overcrowded prison where he shares a cell with a hardened career criminal.

filmography.title: Viva Villa!
filmography.role_description: The legendary Mexican revolutionary leader, portrayed as a boisterous and passionate fighter for the people.
filmography.plot: A fictionalized biography of Pancho Villa as he rises from bandit to revolutionary general fighting against the tyrannical rule in Mexico.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Best Actor (Volpi Cup)

filmography.title: Treasure Island
filmography.role_description: The one-legged pirate cook who befriends young Jim Hawkins while plotting to mutiny and steal the treasure.
filmography.plot: Young Jim Hawkins finds a map to a legendary pirate treasure and sets sail to find it, unaware that the ship's crew are pirates led by Long John Silver.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Nomination – Mussolini Cup

filmography.title: Dinner at Eight
filmography.role_description: A ruthless, loudmouthed mining tycoon who is secretly trying to ruin the business of the dinner party's host.
filmography.plot: A New York socialite tries to organize a perfect dinner party for visiting nobility, but her guests are secretly dealing with major life crises and intrigues.

filmography.title: Min and Bill
filmography.role_description: A drunken fisherman who lives and quarrels with the owner of a waterfront hotel.
filmography.plot: The owner of a dockside inn tries to protect her adopted daughter from the girl's biological mother while managing her relationship with a fisherman.

filmography.title: China Seas
filmography.role_description: A jovial but treacherous trader who is secretly in league with Malay pirates to rob a ship's gold shipment.
filmography.plot: The captain of a steamer carrying a valuable gold shipment must deal with typhoons, pirates, and his former mistress on a voyage from Hong Kong to Singapore.

filmography.title: Tugboat Annie
filmography.role_description: The good-hearted but constantly drunk husband of a formidable tugboat captain.
filmography.plot: The female captain of a tugboat struggles to keep her business afloat and her alcoholic husband out of trouble while their son commands a luxury liner.

filmography.title: The Last of the Mohicans
filmography.role_description: The villainous Huron warrior who seeks revenge against Colonel Munro by targeting his daughters.
filmography.plot: During the French and Indian War, the daughters of a British colonel are escorted through dangerous territory by a Mohican scout and his white adopted son.

filmography.title: Hell Divers
filmography.role_description: A veteran naval chief petty officer who engages in a rivalry with a younger officer.
filmography.plot: Leading Chief Petty Officer Windy Riker and young C.P.O. Steve Nelson are rivals in a Naval aviation squadron until disaster strikes.

filmography.title: Ah, Wilderness!
filmography.role_description: The alcoholic but beloved uncle of a young man coming of age in a small New England town.
filmography.plot: In a turn-of-the-century American town, a teenage boy experiences growing pains and first love while his family deals with his eccentric uncle.

filmography.title: The Secret Six
filmography.role_description: A brutal stockyard worker who rises to become a powerful gang leader.
filmography.plot: Two reporters team up with a secret vigilante group to bring down a vicious bootlegging gang led by a former slaughterhouse worker.

filmography.title: Flesh
filmography.role_description: A gentle, simple-minded German wrestler who is manipulated by a woman and her criminal lover.
filmography.plot: A kind-hearted waiter and wrestler falls for a woman who uses him to help her convict boyfriend, but eventually discovers his own strength.

filmography.title: The Bowery
filmography.role_description: A rough-and-tumble saloon owner in 1890s New York involved in a rivalry with a fellow daredevil.
filmography.plot: Two rival saloon owners in the Bowery district of New York City constantly try to outdo each other with pranks and wagers.

filmography.title: A Date with Judy
filmography.role_description: The misunderstood father of a teenager who mistakenly believes he is having an affair.
filmography.plot: A teenager prepares for her high school dance while suspecting her father of infidelity when he takes rumba lessons.

filmography.title: The Lost World
filmography.role_description: An eccentric and blustering scientist who leads an expedition to a plateau inhabited by dinosaurs.
filmography.plot: An expedition team travels to a remote plateau in the Amazon jungle where prehistoric creatures still roam.

filmography.title: Robin Hood
filmography.role_description: The noble King of England who goes on a Crusade, leaving the kingdom vulnerable to his brother.
filmography.plot: The Earl of Huntingdon adopts the persona of Robin Hood to fight against the tyranny of Prince John while King Richard is away.

filmography.title: Bad Bascomb
filmography.role_description: A notorious outlaw who hides from the law by joining a Mormon wagon train.
filmography.plot: A bank robber fleeing the law joins a wagon train of Mormons and is gradually reformed by the friendship of a little girl.

filmography.title: Slave Ship
filmography.role_description: The treacherous first mate of a ship who refuses to give up the slave trade.
filmography.plot: A ship's captain wants to give up the slave trade and settle down, but his mutinous first mate has other plans.

filmography.title: 20 Mule Team
filmography.role_description: A mule team driver in Death Valley who gets mixed up with a claim jumper.
filmography.plot: A mule driver transporting borax across Death Valley is pursued by a man who knows he is a fugitive from justice.

filmography.title: Barnacle Bill
filmography.role_description: A lazy, heavy-drinking fisherman who tries to avoid marriage and responsibility.
filmography.plot: A shiftless fisherman faces the prospect of actually working when his estranged daughter arrives to live with him.

filmography.title: The Mighty Barnum
filmography.role_description: The legendary showman P.T. Barnum, portrayed in his rise to fame with attractions like Tom Thumb.
filmography.plot: A biographical comedy-drama about the life of P.T.[[1](https://www.google.com/url?sa=E&q=https%3A%2F%2Fvertexaisearch.cloud.google.com%2Fgrounding-api-redirect%2FAUZIYQH25F0DRBSNihruVZs9_Q32NB0cjmCFKQNVB_qMcDd4srtKhLC_Yo3L-bE9-ak9Pxs6lg1-r8oDSFj--uljegAOyHlT34rNK-SDQGFcON0o2cR-XiD205i9AdEtMpN4)] Barnum, his exhibits, and his relationship with the Swedish Nightingale, Jenny Lind.

filmography.title: Big Jack
filmography.role_description: An outlaw leader who rescues a doctor from hanging in his final film role.
filmography.plot: In the early 19th century, an outlaw gang leader saves a doctor from a lynch mob so he can treat the outlaw's leg.

filmography.title: Port of Seven Seas
filmography.role_description: A Marseille bar owner who tries to help his son's pregnant lover.
filmography.plot: A young woman discovers she is pregnant after her lover leaves for sea, and an older man offers to marry her to give the child a name.

filmography.title: Alias a Gentleman
filmography.role_description: An ex-convict who tries to go legitimate as a farmer but is confronted by his past.
filmography.plot: An aging ex-con tries to live an honest life on a farm but his former associates and a woman claiming to be his daughter complicate matters.

filmography.title: Barbary Coast Gent
filmography.role_description: A con artist who heads west and inadvertently becomes a respected citizen.
filmography.plot: A con man forced to leave San Francisco travels to a mining town where he tries to go straight but falls back into old habits.

filmography.title: The Bugle Sounds
filmography.role_description: A veteran cavalry sergeant who resists the transition to mechanized warfare.
filmography.plot: An old-school cavalry sergeant struggles to adapt when his regiment trades in their horses for tanks at the start of WWII.
